instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this lineâ€™s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Works on charger but doesn't recognize battery
threads.message: I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a macbook air that works just fine off the charger but will not recognize the battery, I have tried a new battery but still the same result. <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> reads 5 ohms on the board, but the correct 2k ohms off the board. I get .0034 in diode mode on the <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> line. any help would be great, thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Works on charger but doesn't recognize battery
threads.message: Remove <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and check if you get a higher value in diode mode on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> line, if yes, just replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, if don't the next suspect is SMC.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Works on charger but doesn't recognize battery
threads.message: removed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> still get the same .0033 to ground in diode mode.. is there anywhere i can get a stencil for the smc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Works on charger but doesn't recognize battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Works on charger but doesn't recognize battery
threads.message: I put a new smc on the board and am no longer getting the short to ground on the data line but now i get no light on the charger and when i plug it in the fan runs full speed. the computer trys to boot but fails and gives me a bunch of lines of code on the left side of the screen then takes me to a screen that says to try booting again. Did i buy an smc with no programming?

threads.message: okay so you think the ic is junk.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Works on charger but doesn't recognize battery
threads.message: Uhm you bought a random SMC chip. These chips are unique to each board type. You need to get an identical donor board and take the SMC from there.
